page.title: 04FARM VISITS (CONTINUED)
page.content:
{HIGHFIELD LODGE (CONT) The sheep are crossed Suffolk (males) and Masham (females). The owners keep a few other animals, such as beef cattle, hens and horses. There are no crops on this farm. It got its name from the height of the ground compared with the surrounding area. {APPLEBY LODGE}had 1000 acres, but recently 200 of them were sold to the Wellingborough Park Farm Industrial Estate development. It is a mixed farm with 200 bullocks, 100 cows and 320 ewes. The lambs produced are crossed Jacobs and Masham. The farmer also grows rape, barley, oats, wheat, potatoes, swedes and tomatoes.
All three farms have existed for a long time and are at present relying on members of the family, mainly for the labour.
